senses.de: To gradually make or become stronger or more important
senses.ex: It took years to build up the business.

Tips.title: Long-term Process
Tips.description: Understanding 'build up' as a gradual increase, not an instant change.
Tips.example: Her experience helped to build up her confidence over the years.

Tips.title: Positive Growth
Tips.description: 'Build up' often implies positive progression or advancement.
Tips.example: He is working extra hours to build up his savings.

senses.de: To accumulate or collect over time
senses.ex: Dirt tends to build up in the corners.

Tips.title: Gradual Collection
Tips.description: It refers to things slowly gathering, not appearing suddenly.
Tips.example: Leaves began to build up in the gutter, causing a blockage.

Tips.title: Neglect Result
Tips.description: 'Build up' can indicate a lack of cleaning or maintenance.
Tips.example: Without regular use, dust can build up on old furniture.

senses.de: To prepare or get ready for something gradually
senses.ex: He had to build up courage before he could present in front of the class.

Tips.title: Preparation Context
Tips.description: Often used when talking about preparing mentally or physically for a challenge.
Tips.example: You need to build up endurance for the marathon.

Tips.title: Emotional Undertone
Tips.description: Also used to express the accumulation of feelings or emotional states.
Tips.example: She needed to build up her courage to face her fears.

senses.de: To physically create or construct something over a period of time
senses.ex: They plan to build up the area with new residential buildings.

Tips.title: Physical Development
Tips.description: Relates to constructing or adding to physical structures or areas.
Tips.example: Plans are underway to build up the waterfront with new facilities.

Tips.title: Urban Expansion
Tips.description: Usually involves development or urban growth in a specific area.
Tips.example: The government aims to build up rural areas to improve living standards.

senses.de: To promote or hype something or someone
senses.ex: The concert promoter was building up the artist as the next big thing.

Tips.title: Marketing Strategy
Tips.description: It can suggest the process of generating interest or anticipation for an event or product.
Tips.example: The marketing team wants to build up excitement for the new movie release.

Tips.title: Exaggerate Expectations
Tips.description: It might imply making something seem more important than it is.
Tips.example: Critics claim that the media tends to build up minor incidents into major scandals.

senses.de: To increase in size, quantity, or degree
senses.ex: Tension was building up as the match continued.

Tips.title: Increasing Intensity
Tips.description: Can refer to non-physical things like feelings or situations intensifying.
Tips.example: The build-up of pressure led to a heated argument.

Tips.title: Climactic Build
Tips.description: Often seen in storytelling to describe the lead-up to a climax.
Tips.example: The movie's tension builds up until the thrilling finale.
